Cabot's Pueblo Museum

Explore The Pueblo
Cabot's Pueblo Museum is a marvel of engineering and design that offers a glimpse into the creativity and ingeniousness of Cabot Yerxa, the founder and builder of the pueblo.

About the man & his legacy...

Whether you are planning a wedding, a corporate event, or a private party, Cabot's Pueblo Museum provides the unique backdrop to make your event unforgettable.

Visitors can purchase live tours, virtual tours, grounds-only tickets, or become a member for discounted prices and exclusive offers.

LEARN MORE

Cabot Yerxa was an adventurer, artist, and human rights advocate who built a unique and fascinating pueblo out of reclaimed materials to display his remarkable collection of Native American art and global artifacts.

About the Museum

Cabot Yerxa was an adventurer, artist, and human rights advocate who built a Hopi-inspired pueblo out of reclaimed materials to highlight the culture and contributions of Native Americans.

Learn about Cabot Yerxa
DISCOVER HIS PUEBLO MUSEUM

About the Museum

Cabot Yerxa was an adventurer, artist, and human rights advocate who built a Hopi-inspired pueblo out of reclaimed materials to highlight the culture and contributions of Native Americans.

LEARN ABOUT CABOT YERXA
DISCOVER HIS PUEBLO MUSEUM

Visit the Museum.

Cabot’s Pueblo Museum offers a variety of ways to learn about Cabot Yerxas incredible legacy through tours of the museum, walking in the courtyard, and viewing the outer buildings. Visitors can purchase audio or live tours, grounds-only tickets, or become a member for discounted prices and exclusive offers.

Visit the Museum

Cabot’s Pueblo Museum offers a variety of ways to learn about Cabot Yerxas incredible legacy through tours of the museum, walking in the courtyard, and viewing the outer buildings. Visitors can purchase audio or live tours, grounds-only tickets, or become a member for discounted prices and exclusive offers.

Other Ways to Support

Cabot’s Pueblo Museum is a non-profit organization that relies on your support to keep its doors open. It provides educational opportunities for the community, offering tours, workshops, and other programs as an irreplaceable resource for the preservation of Native American culture.

Other Ways to Support.

Cabot’s Pueblo Museum is a non-profit organization that relies on your support to keep its doors open. It provides educational opportunities for the community, offering tours, workshops, and other programs as an irreplaceable resource for the preservation of Native American culture.

Donate

Your donations keep Cabot's Museum Foundation alive and the legacy of Cabot Yerxa thriving.

Volunteer

Cabots Pueblo Museum invites you to become a part of the TEAM YERXA family through a variety of volunteer opportunities.

Events & Sponsors

Our special events include an annual gala, cultural events, community programs, and more! Join us today as an attendee or sponsor.

Learn and Explore!

Cabot Yerxa had a profound impact on the development of Desert Hot Springs and the Coachella Valley. Check out our Explore page to learn more about his legacy, including Yerxa’s early life and travels, his work as a human rights activist, the construction of his Pueblo, his collection of Native American art and artifacts, and his water discovery on Miracle Hill!

Explore!

Learn and Explore!

Cabot Yerxa had a profound impact on the development of Desert Hot Springs and the Coachella Valley. Check out our Explore page to learn more about his legacy, including Yerxa’s early life and travels, his work as a human rights activist, the construction of his Pueblo, his collection of Native American art and artifacts, and his water discovery on Miracle Hill!

Privacy Overview

This website uses cookies so that we can provide you with the best user experience possible. Cookie information is stored in your browser and performs functions such as recognising you when you return to our website and helping our team to understand which sections of the website you find most interesting and useful.

Strictly Necessary Cookies
